name: Villa Pitiana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Fantastic honeymoon

reviews.text: After a horrendous drive through torrential rain to get to the hotel, the sight of it on the hill ahead of us instantly banished any idea that our experience was going to be anything less than wonderful.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our superior room was in one of the towers at the top of the hotel and was very nice. Simple, clean and huge. The view from the massive windows of the surrounding countryside was as good as it gets.
reviews.title: WOW

likes.liked: — The calm and quiet, and the view

reviews.title: Perfect Wedding at Villa Pitiana
reviews.text: The restaurant was expensive but the food was great. Yes, the choice was limited but as a treat once or twice throughout our stay it did the trick. The staff too were great, especially the sommelier Michael.
I would recommend the cooking course. As a keen cook it didn't necessarily teach my anything new but it was a fun way to spend a morning.
reviews.title: Romantic, great location

reviews.text: We are four Australian women from Sydney who have just spent 11 wonderful nights and days, in mid September, at the Villa Pitiana. It sits majestically yet gently amonst the most beautiful Tuscan countryside which we enjoyed exploring along the 'Yellow Walk' nature trail. We spent balmy days at the poolside interspersed with exciting day tours of various neighbouring towns. This was made easy as we found the best guided day tours through the hotel. Our courteous and helpful drivers Danielle and Francesco showed us the real Toscano (Tuscany). We don't believe we would have had the same depth of experience had we driven ourselves.
reviews.title: Bella Villa Pitiana
Great hotel & great trips to make
reviews.text: Originally we had planned to self cater but after our first meal at the beautiful, gourmet restaurant we changed our minds and ate there nearly every night sampling new taste delights each time. We also enjoyed the comprehensive wine list. We particularly enjoyed the musical entertainment on a Thursday evening which replaced the usual taped music in the dining room.

reviews.title: Disappointing
reviews.text: We loved the age of the Hotel Pitiana as it was part of its charm. And the Villa and the Staff certainly did Charm us. They couldn't have been more helpful, professional or courteous and they work very hard and long hours. One of our group became sick and the staff went out of their way to get her to a doctor in Tosi and ensure she got well quickly.

Finally, we were lucky enough to be a part of a 3 day cooking course at the Villa which we had organised from Australia. What a lot of fun it was. Each of our chefs Fabio, Stefano & Telemaco and our interpreter Marco made the experience educational, interesting and enjoyable which is what cooking should be. And don't forget...Delicious! We highly recommend this if you are interested in learning about Tuscan food and a Tuscan philosophy of life.
reviews.title: My Favourite Place In the World
Not what we expected
reviews.text: The villa certainly was a highlight in our 5 week holiday and we would only be too happy to return one day. If only we were closer we would return sooner.

We have been to Villa Pitiana about 4 times now, and it is somewhere we will carry on going every 2 years! Yeah the bathrooms are old and need updating, yeah the bed is very un-comfortable and the floor is cold, but its tuscany, not a city!
reviews.title: Beautiful, the best in Tuscany!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thoroughly recommend this for anyone who wants to see Tuscany and Florence but not stay in the middle of a city. Pitiana is at the top of a hill by the village of Donnini about 30 minutes drive from central Florence. The place is just beautiful with lovely large common rooms, a great view and a pleasant pool area in the grounds. Our room was enormous and very well designed. The huge room had a galleried bedroom above the living area with a lovely painted ceiling. Through the window we woke to wonderful views of the grounds, the pool and the countryside beyond.
reviews.title: Total Tranquility

likes.disliked: — Shabby (but clean) rooms and an elevator that was like a death trap.
